comments.text: This is your spot if you wanna try and get a ride directly from Prizren to Skopje. First car that stopped for me was headed to Skopje as I think people going to Pristina are using the highway. Saw a NMK license plate at the gas station too. Make sure to stand after the gas station as all the cars rhat stopped for me came from the gas station not the road

Got a ride directly to Skopje, there were a couple NMK license plates at the gas station so I think this is your spot for Prizren-Skopje without stopping in Pristina. Make sure to hitch after the gas station because everyone that offered me a ride came from the station not the road
It's impossible to wait in Kosovo
Kosovo is hitchhiking heaven, it looks like you can stay anywhere and everyone will stop for you.
Literally first car stopped, typical Kosovo experience with the most helpful people I've ever met.
As good spot as it gets, traffic is slow here and it's on the only main road leading directly to Pejë
Not much traffic, but a guy waiting for his friend approach me to talk and they ended up giving me a ride close to Pristine where I wanted to go
Straight to pristina, I waited outside the gas station with my thumb out and got a ride within like 5 mins. No shade but there is within the gas station obviously
Tried whitout sign and a young man took me and even showed me around his village and all the neighbouring villages bevore taking me to gjakovica
Got almost instant ride to Gjakovë - the first bigger city on the way, so it was not difficult
Had to walk here from Kaçanik, because the road I was on was closed. It was already close to dark, but a very nice woman stopped, took me to the border and bought me something from the bakery.
Big petrol station, big parking, and Burger King. Open 24/7.
Got a free haircut here with a hair stylist who had five years of experience in spite of being only 17 years old. Then he stopped a bus for me that took me to Ferizaj for free.

Not so many cars, but I got a ride with a local after some time. He went to a hairstylist that gave me a free haircut after he finished my ride. Then he stopped a bus for me that took me for free to Ferizaj. And he was only 17.
Waited at the car park there. Decent traffic, but mostly local I think. Got a ride a bit into the valley to a gas station. There I waited a bit and then took a bus after some time.
Good place to wait with lots of traffic into the city or towards the Highway. Got taken by a local that dropped me in the city center.
Very busy spot, but seems to work very well. Got a ride with a semi local that was going into Albania. Dropped me some way from Prizren in a good place.
Lots of traffic and a bakery right across the street. Didn't have to wait long for a ride with some locals that showed me the artificial lake and dropped me at a good spot.

Very easy to hitchhike towards Pejë. Of you go on a hike in this area you can easily count on somebody to bring you back.

In this spot there is a very friendly Kosovan man who camps on the river. He has a lot of signs like hotel and café. That is kind of a joke, but he will actually offer you coffee and even a place to sleep if needed I think. He will also show you all of his funny constructions he made there.

BE AWARE: he says he has been drinking the water in the river for 15 years and n
After visiting a monastery, got a ride very quickly to Štrpce.

Well its not the best idea to go to Montenegro through here, turns out the border is closed regarding the roads. We had to walk 30km with no food, after 10km workers went and came back for us. Definitely EXTREME
A local driver said, "I'll let you off here, this is the best spot towards Macedonia". We were still sorting our bags when a car stopped to take us to Ferizaj.
Towards Kacanik and Macedonian border. Was dropped here as part of a very quick succession of rides from Prishtina to Skopje.
Great spot, big traffic, nice place to stop in the bus station. Got ride straight to Albania.
Very good spot. A guy took me to Suhareka, 15km from Prizren.
Cars occasionally stop but not for you. With sign works better. As I went up to a guy asked if he wants money, said no and took all the way to Peja
Not a lot of traffic but people are helpful.
Towards Macedonian Border.
Right now it's a good spot, as cars slow down because of road works, but that may change in the future. Got a ride with some workers quickly.
Long wait cus cars take some time to check documents to cross the boarder, but in the end a polish trucker ended up picking me up, taking me almost till Belgrade. Waited around 3h
Border stations are always good. Had a sign saying Kruševac and Belegrad (both in Cyrillic) and got a ride to Kruševac:))

Hitching in Gora is special. the people are some of the kindest I've ever met. the road was quiet, but good quality, so enough cars. lorries are good because they seem more likely to be going to Prizren (which is what i did). be sure to, like all of these rural quiet roads in hiking areas, to be assertive in your method
Busy street, but not so busy at the gas station itself.
Most of drivers going towards Prishtina take this road, and they can conveniently pull over on the petrol station
Got a ride within 30 minutes from here to Prishtina

Most of the cars are turing around here or stopping at the grocery store. But we needed to go to kuqishte. But some guy eventually stopped. A lot of space to pull over. But kinda need to stand at the end of parking lot because before it its a blind corner so they dont see you.
Probably the best spot going into the mountains. Got picked up by a couple who were going to back to their hotel. Some space to stop and cars are going only to the mountains
Nice spot to go north because cars are slow after round about and there a lot of space to stop. We were just going to the waterfall so a local went a bit out of his way to drive us there.

Probably one of the better spots to go north. A lot of space to pull over but two lanes so not everybody could stop but there is a traffic light right before. Were trying to hitch but got picked up by bus to peja so we were ok fine lets go with bus because it was already quite late
Not bad, just very muddy.
Good spot. Plenty of space to stop. Most people go to Pristina, but I managed to find a guy who drove me to downtown Prizen.

It seemed like a good spot with a lot of space to stop and also traffic from the waterfall but noone stopped and when we started walking a border guard going home just pulled over and offered to take us to peja so tahts nice.
Had no luck in this place with a sign "Podujeve"
Was walking the road out north trying to get to the border with Serbia. Was not using sign saying Serbia just to prevent any conflicts, better without a sign between Kosovo and Serbia haha:)
